result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin Eugene Edley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Update Info (2nd+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
2 yrs initial confinement
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 15CF135 & 15CF259

superMiscConds.notes: $ 518.00   DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.    If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Follow all recommendations by agent and follow through with all programming by department

supervisions.notes:
3 yrs extended supervision
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 15CF135 & 15CF259

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
03:55 PM Defendant Robin Eugene Edley in court with attorney Christian J Ness.  Defendant Robin Eugene Edley in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites the agreement, all parties agree.   Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.    DEF enters NC plea.    DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.    Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.  State makes statement prior to sentencing, request the court to accept joint recommendation.   Attny Ness makes statement prior to sentencing, and request court accept joint recommendation.  DEF makes statement to court.   Court to follow agreement.  

COURT:  5 years prison.  2 years initial confinement.   3 years extended supervision.  Consecutive to 15CF135 and 15CF259  Conditions of extended supervision:   Follow all recommendations by agent and follow through with all programming by department.   Court Costs.   DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

COMBINED BOND:   15CF276, 15CF259, and 20CM124.   DEF must keep in compliance with sex offender registry program.

11:21 AM Defendant Robin Eugene Edley in court with attorney Christian J Ness (special appearance).  Defendant Robin Eugene Edley in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.    DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address (homeless).   Attny Ness indicates unable to speak to DEF for qualification.   Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.    State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Ness unable to argue bond without speaking to DEF.    Court takes note, for Attny Ness to make bond argument at next hearing.   Court sets bond.   CBS $5000  COMBINED BOND:   15CF276, 15CF259, and 20CM124.   DEF must keep in compliance with sex offender registry program.   Court sets preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2021 at 11:45 am.
